info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 16 at 9:43PM PDT until August 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED THIS WEEK... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 11 PM PDT THURSDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 617 AND 625... * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop have a high probability of spreading rapidly. Abundant lightning can also ignite new fires and strain fire fighting resources. * AFFECTED AREAS...In Oregon...eastern portions of Fire weather zone 617 and Fire weather zone 625. This includes portions of the Umpqua National Forest, and BLM land in eastern Lake County. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated showers and thunderstorms are expected through Thursday morning. Then, the potential increases for thunderstorms with a mix of isolated to scattered thunderstorms expected Thursday afternoon and evening. Storms will trend wetter on Thursday, but lightning strikes outside of the wet cores are still likely. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts 30 to 40 mph. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit now. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Where will you go? How will you get there? Who will you call to let others know your are safe? Visit ready.gov/wildfires for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.
